required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Study of Yimitasvir in Healthy Adults Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Randomized，Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose, Single-center Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic of Yimitasvir in Healthy Adults Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Study of Chronic Hepatitis C Treatment Drug Yimitasvir in Healthy Adults Subjects.

detailed_description.textblock:
This was a Randomized，Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose, Single-center Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic of Yimitasvir in Healthy Adults Subjects
A total of 56 healthy subjects were divided into 7 groups, with each group consisting of 8 subjects. Six of the subjects received the investigational drug, and two received placebo. All of the subjects received a single dose.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: To assess the safety and tolerability after a single dose of DAG181

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing (0 h) and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 h after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of DAG181

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing (0 h) and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 h after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Time of the maximum observed plasma concentration

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing (0 h) and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 h after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing (0 h) and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 h after dosing
